info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 8:43PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN DE SOTO... NORTHWESTERN RED RIVER...SOUTHERN CADDO AND SOUTHWESTERN BOSSIER PARISHES...SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON AND NORTHEASTERN PANOLA COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 843 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blanchard to near Greenwood to 8 miles southeast of Marshall. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Marshall, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Stonewall, Deberry, Elysian Fields, Fosters, Scottsville, Keachi, Grand Cane, Longstreet, Keat Chie, Ferguson, Front, Spring Ridge, Cross Lake, and Kingston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
